Description.Content: Provides support for building shapes such as rectangles, ovals, lines and rings via an xml file. Shape elements can be nested inside layer-list entities via the 'item' tag.
A generic shape such as a rectangle, oval, line or ring defined in XML.
Defines the XML namespace, which must be 'http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android'.
Defines the type of shape.
A rectangle that fills the containing View. This is the default shape.
An oval shape that fits the dimensions of the containing View.
A horizontal line that spans the width of the containing View. This shape requires the 'stroke' element to define the width of the line.
A ring shape.
The radius for the inner part of the ring (the hole in the middle), as a dimension value or dimension resource.

The radius for the inner part of the ring, expressed as a ratio of the ring's width. For instance, if android:innerRadiusRatio='5', then the inner radius equals the ring's width divided by 5. This value is overridden by android:innerRadius. Default value is 9.
The thickness of the ring, as a dimension value or dimension resource.

The thickness of the ring, expressed as a ratio of the ring's width. For instance, if android:thicknessRatio='2', then the thickness equals the ring's width divided by 2. This value is overridden by android:innerRadius. Default value is 3.
'true' if this is used as a LevelListDrawable. This should normally be 'false' or your shape may not appear.
Creates rounded corners for the shape. Applies only when the shape is a rectangle.
The radius for all corners, as a dimension value or dimension resource. This is overridden for each corner by the following attributes.
The radius for the top-left corner, as a dimension value or dimension resource.
The radius for the top-right corner, as a dimension value or dimension resource.
The radius for the bottom-left corner, as a dimension value or dimension resource.
The radius for the bottom-right corner, as a dimension value or dimension resource.
Specifies a gradient color for the shape.
The angle for the gradient, in degrees. 0 is left to right, 90 is bottom to top. It must be a multiple of 45. Default is 0.
The relative X-position for the center of the gradient (0 - 1.0).
The relative Y-position for the center of the gradient (0 - 1.0).
Optional color that comes between the start and end colors, as a hexadecimal value or color resource.
The ending color, as a hexadecimal value or color resource.
The radius for the gradient. Only applied when android:type='radial'.
The starting color, as a hexadecimal value or color resource.
The type of gradient pattern to apply.
A linear gradient. This is the default.
A radial gradient. The start color is the center color.
A sweeping line gradient.
'true' if this is used as a LevelListDrawable.
Padding to apply to the containing View element (this pads the position of the View content, not the shape).
Left padding, as a dimension value or dimension resource.
Right padding, as a dimension value or dimension resource.
Top padding, as a dimension value or dimension resource.
Bottom padding, as a dimension value or dimension resource.
The size of the shape.
The height of the shape, as a dimension value or dimension resource.
The width of the shape, as a dimension value or dimension resource.
A solid color to fill the shape.
The color to apply to the shape, as a hexadecimal value or color resource.
A solid color to fill the shape.
The thickness of the line, as a dimension value or dimension resource.
The color of the line, as a hexadecimal value or color resource.
The distance between line dashes, as a dimension value or dimension resource. Only valid if android:dashWidth is set.
The size of each dash line, as a dimension value or dimension resource. Only valid if android:dashGap is set.
